title: 110_hr2547
content: The "FDIC Enforcement Enhancement Act" is the short title of the Act. It focuses on enforcing against misrepresentations regarding FDIC deposit insurance coverage. The "FDIC Enforcement Enhancement Act" prohibits false advertising and misuse of FDIC names to indicate insured status. The "FDIC Enforcement Enhancement Act" prohibits misrepresentation of deposit insurance status in advertisements or documents. The "FDIC Enforcement Enhancement Act" prohibits misrepresentation of deposit insurance status in advertisements or documents. The Corporation has jurisdiction over violations of this rule and the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation insures deposit liabilities not covered by the Corporation. The FDIC Enforcement Enhancement Act grants the Corporation authority to enforce requirements regarding investigations and enforcement actions as if the person were a state nonmember insured bank. Other legal actions are not barred by this provision. Section 8(c) of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act is amended to include a new paragraph allowing the Corporation to issue temporary orders for false advertising or misuse of names indicating insured status. The FDIC Enforcement Enhancement Act grants the Corporation authority to issue temporary orders for false advertising or misuse of names indicating insured status, which must be followed to prevent or remedy violations. Temporary orders take effect upon service and remain enforceable until the completion of an administrative proceeding. The FDIC Enforcement Enhancement Act grants the Corporation authority to issue temporary orders for violations, with civil money penalties up to $1,000,000 per day for violations of section 18(a)(4). Technical and conforming amendments are made to the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.
